page.title: 15 RECREATION
page.content: The village appears to have a busy community life.The pub,The Jersey Arms is the focal point. The church organises a musical group and days out. To keep the village spirit alive a village concert is organised each christmas and also a christmas bazaar, a harvest supper and occasional fetes are held. The local cricket club have their grounds in the estate in a real olde English setting. As the population is small, many people travel to partake in group and sports activities, for example, Womens Institute to Bicester or Stoke Lyne; Scouts,Brownies etc to Chesterton; Bicester and Ploughley sports centre and also Oxford.
